intro: Gymnosiphon cornutus, commonly known as the horned gymnosiphon, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asparagaceae and is characterized by its unique, spiky floral structures. The plant produces small, white or pale green flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Gymnosiphon cornutus is often found in rocky or coastal habitats, where it thrives in well-drained soils. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for both horticultural and ecological studies.
